If the og:image tag has not been set for a page, the social network will scan the page to find the most appropriate image to include in social posts, which is usually the first image it finds. A link preview image may not appear at all if a robots.txt file or security software is used to prevent page crawling. Featured image display issues If your social post preview is displaying the expected featured image, but the image is displaying incorrectly, you can check the following. Image size or ratio is incorrect If the featured image isn't appearing correctly in your social preview (e.g., the image is cut off or the ratio is incorrect), you may need to edit the image so it has the right dimensions for the social network you're posting to, then republish the page. The following dimensions are recommended for featured image optimization on each network: Facebook : 1.91:1 X: 16:9 for photo posts and 1.91:1 for featured images in link posts Instagram (square): 1:1 Instagram (portrait): 4:5 Instagram (landscape): 1.91:1 LinkedIn (landscape): 1.91:1 Ensure that any media included in your social posts follows the file size guidelines for each network. If HubSpot determines that a file is too large to post to a certain network, a warning will appear when creating the social post. These are the maximum file sizes for each social network: Facebook: 8MB (under 1MB recommended for PNG files to avoid pixelation) Instagram: 8MB X: 5MB (15MB for GIFs) LinkedIn: 10MB Differences in image color Embedded color profiles may impact how your featured image appears in your social post. Different systems process uncommon color profiles in different ways, which is why the colors may look different when previewing the image in your file manager. You can run your image URL through an external tool to see if it’s using an uncommon color profile. If necessary, you can remove the interfering color profile in an external photo editing tool like Photoshop, then republish the page before publishing your social post. Differences in image clarity HubSpot’s file manager uses image compression on JPEGs and PNGs to help optimize loading speeds on your HubSpot-hosted content. Social media networks also use image compression in posts, which may vary in quality from what you see in HubSpot. For this reason, it’s recommended to use relatively high-resolution images for each network. If your image doesn’t conform with a social network’s requirements, a warning will appear in HubSpot’s social publishing tool to help adjust your image accordingly. Social

titulo: Use the intelligence tab
conteudo: The intelligence tab is featured on company records and provides data enrichment and website visit-based data insights for the company. With the intelligence tab, you can quickly assess fit and inform key account-based qualification, routing, prospecting, and outreach decisions. To navigate to the intelligence tab: In your HubSpot account, navigate to CRM > Companies . Click the name of the company you’d like to enrich. At the top, click the Intelligence tab. Properties populated by the intelligence tab The intelligence tab populates enriched data for the following default company properties as available: Annual revenue Company domain name Company keywords Company logo Company name Country/Region Description Employee range Facebook company page Industry Industry group Is public LinkedIn company page LinkedIn handle Number of employees Phone number Postal code Revenue range State/Region Street Address Total Money Raised Web Technologies Website URL X account handle Year founded Update your data If you have a Starter , Professional , or Enterprise subscription and you've purchased Breeze Intelligence credits , you can enrich your data. If any company properties are incorrect or missing, there'll be an enrichment prompt at the top of the Intelligence tab. When enriching your data, current property values will be populated or overwritten. To update your data: In your HubSpot account, navigate to CRM > Companies . Click the name of the company you’d like enrich. At the top, click the Intelligence tab If new data is available, click Enrich . If your data is up to date, no action is needed and the Enrich button won't be available. In the right panel, review the properties you want to enrich. By default, all properties will be selected. If you’d like to retain any of your current property values, click the property checkbox to de-select properties you don’t want to enrich. Click Enrich . Review visitor activity If you have a Starter , Professional , or Enterprise subscription and you've purchased Breeze Intelligence credits , i n the top right of the intelligence tab, you can find information about the company visiting your website in the last 30 rolling days. In your HubSpot account, navigate to CRM > Companies . Click the name of the company to review. At the top, click the Intelligence tab In the Visitor activity table, you can review: Website visits : the total number of times people from the company have visited your website. The arrow and percentage shows if visits have changed month over month. Line graph : shows the number of visits over the last 30 days. Unique visitors: total number of unique visitors to your website from the company. Last seen: when someone from the company last visited your site. Top pages & paths: website pages most frequently visited by people from the company. This includes the total number of visits to each page. Review company information To review company information on the Intelligence tab: In your HubSpot account, navigate to CRM > Companies . Click the name of the company to review. At the top, click the Intelligence tab. If you have a Starter , Professional , or Enterprise subscription and you've purchased Breeze Intelligence add-on, at the top, you can review key information about the company including: Employees : the total number of employees. Type: indicates if it is public or private company. Annual revenue: the total amount of money earned by the company over a 12-month period. Below, you can also review basic information about the company such as address, industry, description, and company keywords . To review additional information about the company’s general information, industry, financials, location, tech, and social channels, click the relevant title to expand each section. If you are a user in an account with free tools or you haven't purchased Breeze Intelligence credits , at the top, you can review information about the company including: description, industry, country, employees, founded year. properties CRM records AI Tools

titulo: Create programmable emails (BETA)
conteudo: Programmable emails allow you to use advanced HubL syntax to fully personalize the content of your emails. Learn more about how to create modules and render data from your CRM in HubSpot's developer documentation . Please note: you should thoroughly test any modules or templates, along with their associated dependents, before running a live email campaign. Data sources available for programmable emails The data you can use in a programmable email depends on your HubSpot subscription: If you have a Marketing Hub Professional account, you can render data from standard CRM objects, such as contacts, companies, and products. If you have a Marketing Hub Enterprise subscription, you can include structured data sources such as HubDB tables and custom objects in programmable emails. Enable programmable email for your modules or templates Before you start creating programmable emails, you must first enable the feature for the associated module or coded template: In your HubSpot account, navigate to Content > Design Manager . To enable programmable email for a module: Create a new module , and select the Email templates checkbox when choosing where the module will be used. In the inspector on the right, toggle the Enable module for programmable email beta switch on. In the dialog box, review whether the module has any dependents. If the module has any dependents, review them, then select the I have reviewed the dependents checkbox. Click Enable . To enable programmable email for a custom coded template: Create a new template , and under Template type , select Email . Add the isEnabledForEmailV3Rendering: true annotation to the top of the template file. When you're done editing your template, click Publish changes in the top right. In the dialog box, review whether the module has any dependents. If the module has any dependents, review them, then select the I have reviewed the dependents checkbox. Click Enable . To use programmable email in a template you're creating in the drag and drop editor , drag a module that you've already enabled for programmable email into the template. If you're drafting an email in the drag and drop email editor , you can use a programmable module you've created by dragging the module into the body of the email. BETA Marketing Email

titulo: Analise o desempenho do seu bot
conteudo: Compare o desempenho de cada bot lado a lado e determine quais bots têm a maior taxa de conclusão de conversação. Também pode ver uma análise da forma como os seus visitantes interagem com cada acção do bot. Na sua conta HubSpot, acesse Automações > Fluxos de chat . Passe o cursor do rato sobre o bot que pretende analisar e clique em Details . Clique no menu pendente Date range para filtrar os seus dados por um intervalo de tempo específico. Se seleccionar um intervalo de datas constituído por uma semana, o dia de início predefinido é o domingo. Na parte superior do relatório, veja uma contagem total de conversas de bot que foram iniciadas, concluídas ou abandonadas. Iniciado: o número de conversas iniciadas com o bot. Conclusões: o número de sessões em que um utilizador interagiu com o bot até uma acção final. A duração da sessão é definida na configuração Session timeout do bot. Abandoned: o número de sessões em que um utilizador interagiu com o bot, mas não completou uma ação final. A duração da sessão é definida na definição do bot Session timeout . Analise os seus dados na visualização do gráfico Action Completion . Na parte superior da visualização do gráfico, clique numa métrica para personalizar os dados apresentados no relatório. Para adicionar este relatório ao seu painel de controlo, clique em + Guardar no painel de controlo . Clique no menu suspenso Actions selected para exibir os dados de uma ação de bot específica na visualização do gráfico. Seleccione a caixa de verificação junto a uma acção que pretenda visualizar. Abaixo da visualização de gráfico, use a tabela para ver os detalhes de cada ação do bot. Veja uma contagem do número de vezes que cada acção foi iniciada, quantas foram concluídas com êxito e quantas não foram desencadeadas. Inbox

titulo: Imposto sobre valor agregado (IVA) da Rússia | Perguntas frequentes
conteudo: Observação: este artigo foi preparado apenas para fins informativos. Ele não se destina a fornecer e não deve ser considerado como aconselhamento fiscal. Em caso de dúvidas, você deve consultar seus próprios consultores tributários e/ou jurídicos. Se a sua empresa estiver localizada na Rússia, saiba como a HubSpot administra o IVA e como você pode atualizar o HubSpot com suas informações relacionadas ao IVA. O IVA geralmente é atribuído na venda e no fornecimento de produtos e/ou serviços. O IVA aplica-se a maioria dos produtos e serviços que são comprados e vendidos para uso ou consumo na Rússia. Geralmente, o IVA é faturado pelo fornecedor dos produtos ou serviços e recolhido do cliente. Em seguida, o fornecedor informará e remeterá o IVA recolhido para as autoridades fiscais. O governo da Federação Russa mudou as regras de IVA para serviços digitais prestados por fornecedores estrangeiros, como a HubSpot. Os fornecedores estrangeiros que são obrigados a se registrar para o IVA devem coletar o imposto relevante sobre as vendas de serviços digitais para todos os clientes na Federação Russa. A partir de 1 de maio de 2021 , a HubSpot cobra o IVA aos clientes cujo endereço principal da empresa seja na Federação Russa. Saiba como verificar como o endereço principal da sua empresa está definido na HubSpot . Veja abaixo as perguntas frequentes relacionadas ao IVA para clientes na Rússia. Quais serviços da HubSpot estão sujeitos ao IVA? Os serviços de assinatura são considerados um serviço digital para fins de IVA na Rússia e têm uma taxa de 16,67% do valor bruto. Isso inclui todas as ferramentas e serviços da HubSpot. Embora não seja considerado um serviço digital, o suporte ao cliente está sujeito ao IVA como um serviço de consultoria, pois o local de fornecimento é a Rússia. Como atualizar o HubSpot com minhas informações de IVA? Entre em contato com billing@hubspot.com com os seguintes detalhes: Uma confirmação se você pagou o IVA atuando como agente fiscal (em nome do fornecedor estrangeiro, a HubSpot) em qualquer fatura da HubSpot. Se você pagou o IVA em todas as faturas da HubSpot, a HubSpot pode solicitar as devoluções de IVA relacionadas e a ordem de pagamento para suporte. Seu número de identificação fiscal (NFI). Há um valor de compra mínimo antes que o IVA seja aplicado? Não. Todo o fornecimento de serviços eletrônicos, hospedagem e consultoria para clientes na Rússia (empresas e pessoas físicas) estão sujeitos ao IVA russo. O HubSpot fornece serviços isentos de IVA ou não tributáveis? Não. Todos os serviços atualmente fornecidos pela HubSpot aos clientes na Rússia estão sujeitos ao IVA russo. Há isenções especiais aplicáveis a instituições de caridade sob as quais o IVA não pode ser cobrado? Não. Não há isenções de IVA disponíveis de acordo com as regras de IVA da Rússia para os serviços que a HubSpot fornece às instituições de caridade na Rússia. O IVA será aplicado mesmo se uma empresa russa fornecer um número de identificação fiscal válido para a HubSpot? Sim. O IVA aplica-se a todos os serviços que a HubSpot fornece aos clientes na Rússia. Como cliente, tenho alguma obrigação de IVA? Não. Se você está registrado para o IVA na Rússia e deseja reivindicar um crédito de imposto a montante para o IVA pago à HubSpot, no mínimo, mantenha uma cópia da fatura da HubSpot para seus registros. Para quaisquer outras questões sobre como reivindicar um crédito de imposto a montante, entre em contato com o seu consultor fiscal. billing

titulo: Add personalization tokens to an email subject line
conteudo: When creating a marketing email, you use personalize the subject line to affirm you value your audience and that the content is relevant to them. The best email subject lines stand out in a subscriber's inbox. Personalization allows you greet your subscriber by name, feature a topic they've expressed interest in, or congratulate them on a birthday or anniversary. Research shows that personalization leads to more email opens and clicks . To add a personalization token to your email: In your HubSpot account, navigate to Marketing > Email . Hover over the name of the email you want to edit and click Edit , or click Create email at the upper right. Click the Settings tab. Locate the Subject line field and click Personalize . In the dialog box, click the Type dropdown menu and select Contacts or Company . Click the Property dropdown menu, and select the contact property or company property you want to use. Add a local default value or choose to Use this property's global default value . Click Insert .

titulo: Russian Value Added Tax (VAT) | Frequently Asked Questions
conteudo: Please note: this article has been prepared for informational purposes only. It is not intended to provide, and should not be relied on as tax advice. For any questions you should consult your own tax and/or legal advisors. If your business is located in Russia, learn how HubSpot handles Value Added Tax (VAT) and how you can update HubSpot with your VAT-related information. VAT is generally due when goods and/or services are sold and supplied. VAT applies to most goods and services that are bought and sold for use or consumption in Russia. Generally, VAT is invoiced by the supplier of goods or services, then collected from the customer. The supplier then reports and remits the collected VAT to the tax authorities. The Government of the Russian Federation has changed the VAT rules for digital services provided by foreign suppliers like HubSpot. Foreign suppliers that are required to register for VAT must collect the relevant tax on sales of digital services to all customers in the Russian Federation. As of, May 1, 2021 HubSpot charges VAT to customers whose primary company address is in the Russian Federation. Learn how to check what your primary company address is set to in HubSpot . Below are frequently asked questions related to VAT for customers in Russia. Which HubSpot services are liable for VAT? Subscription services are considered an e-service for VAT purposes in Russia, and have a rate of 16.67% of the gross amount. This includes all of HubSpot’s tools and services. While not considered an e-service, customer support is subject to VAT as a consulting service because the place of supply is Russia. How do I update HubSpot with my VAT information? Reach out to billing@hubspot.com with the following details: A confirmation of whether you have paid VAT acting as a tax agent (on behalf of the foreign supplier, HubSpot) on any HubSpot invoices. If you've paid VAT on any HubSpot invoices, HubSpot may request the related VAT returns and payment order for support. Your Taxpayer Personal Identification Number (INN). Is there a minimum purchase amount before VAT is applied? No. All supplies of electronic services, hosting and consulting services to customers in Russia (both business and individuals) are subject to Russian VAT. Does HubSpot provide VAT exempt or non-VAT taxable services? No. All services currently provided by HubSpot to customers in Russia are subject to Russian VAT. Are there any special exemptions applicable for charities under which VAT may not be charged? No. There are no exemptions from VAT available under Russian VAT rules for the services HubSpot supplies to charities in Russia. Will VAT apply even if a Russian company provides a valid Taxpayer Personal Identification number to HubSpot? Yes. VAT applies to all the services that HubSpot supplies to customers in Russia. Are there any VAT obligations for me as a customer? No. If you are registered for VAT in Russia and you want to claim an input tax credit for the VAT paid to HubSpot, as a minimum you should ensure to keep a copy of HubSpot’s invoice for your records. For any further questions on claiming an input tax credit, please speak to your tax advisor. billing

titulo: Adicionar designs do Canva ao seu conteúdo do HubSpot
conteudo: Melhore seus esforços de marketing com os gráficos Canva. Você pode projetar uma imagem no Canva e, em seguida, pode usar essa imagem no HubSpot ao criar um post social, anúncio, página ou email do HubSpot. Não é possível importar fontes ou sua kit de marca Canva para uso nos editores do HubSpot. Em vez disso, você pode criar gráficos no Canva e, em seguida, inserir essas imagens no HubSpot. Para aprender mais sobre os fundamentos do uso do Canva, confira o Guia de introdução ao Canva . Por favor, observe: para usar o Canva com o seu conteúdo HubSpot, cookies de terceiros não devem ser bloqueados no seu navegador. Você precisará ativar os cookies ou adicionar uma exceção para o HubSpot . Para usar os designs do Canva no conteúdo do HubSpot: No editor de conteúdo do HubSpot, comece adicionando uma imagem à sua postagem social, anúncio, página ou e-mail: Ao criar uma página , postagem de blog ou e-mail de gerenciamento usando o editor de e-mail clássico , clique no insertImage na parte superior do editor. Ao criar um e-mail usando o editor de arrastar e soltar , clique e arraste um Imagem elemento do Contente guia no painel esquerdo para o editor de e-mail. Então clique Selecionar imagem . Quando criando uma postagem social , clique no ícone de imagem insertImage na parte inferior do compositor do post. Ao criar um Anúncio de lead do Facebook ou Anúncio de geração de leads do LinkedIn , clique Selecionar imagem/vídeo no Anúncio guia do editor de anúncios. No painel direito, clique no ícone Carregar e selecione Design com Canva . Selecione um formato para sua imagem do Canva. Se essa é a primeira vez usando o Canva no HubSpot, você será solicitado a fazer login na sua conta do Canva ou a configurar uma nova conta. Crie a imagem no editor do Canva. Para salvar seu design no gerenciador de arquivos, no canto superior direito, clique em Salvar . No painel direito, selecione sua nova imagem . O design do Canva será inserido no conteúdo do HubSpot. titulo: Access the HTML of an email you sent from HubSpot
conteudo: You can view and copy the HTML of an email sent from HubSpot by following the instructions below. In your HubSpot account, navigate to Marketing > Email . Locate and click on the name of the sent email. Under your email name, hover the preview of your email and click View email . This will open a web version of your email in your browser. To view the raw HTML of your email, right-click on the page, then select View Page Source . To copy the email's HTML to your clipboard, highlight the content on the page, right-click, then select Copy .

titulo: Target Google ads using HubSpot audiences
conteudo: After creating Google Ads audiences in HubSpot, you must associate them with a ad campaign in order to see them in your Google Ads account. You can also use the audiences you created in HubSpot when you create search Google campaigns directly in the ads tool. Navigate to your Google Ads account . In the left sidebar menu, navigate to Campaigns . In the right panel, click the + icon . Then, click create New campaign or Resume campaign draft . Select a campaign objective , campaign type , and enter a campaign name . Then, click Continue . In the left navigation menu, under the Targeting section, click Audience . In the right panel, click Audience to expand the section. Click Create an audience . In the right panel, enter an audience name . In the Your data section, click the search bar . Then, click the Browse tab To use one of your website visitor audiences, click Website Visitors . To use one of your contact list audiences, click Custom combination . Select the checkboxes next to the names of any of the audiences you created in HubSpot that you want your campaign to target. After selecting your audiences, continue creating your ad campaign. When the ad campaign is published, it will appear in the HubSpot ads tool. Learn more about audience reporting and segments in Google's Help Center . ads

titulo: Create custom analytics views
conteudo: Analytics views are filters that you can apply on the Sources tab and the Pages tab in the traffic analytics tool to filter the data for easier analysis. Analytics views can be customized by your domains, visitor country, and more. By default, an analytics view will be created for each primary domain when you connect the domain or set an existing domain as primary. Depending on your subscription, there is a limit to the number of custom analytics views that can be created in an account. Please note: only users with the Edit website settings permission can create and edit analytics views. Before you get started When creating an analytics view, keep the following in mind: An analytics view will start tracking data the day it's created and will not include historical data. If you update an existing view, the existing data will not update to match your changes. Sessions will only be tracked in an analytics view if the session starts on the location specified in the view. For example, if you create a view for the www subdomain and landing-page/form URL path, sessions will only count when they start at landing-page/form . Create and manage analytics views To create and manage custom analytics views: In your HubSpot account, click the settings settings icon in the top navigation bar. In the left sidebar menu, navigate to Tracking & analytics > Tracking Code . Click the Analytics views tab. You can see your existing custom analytics views in the Custom analytics views table. To create a new view, click + Add another view . In the right sidebar, enter a view Name . Click the filter options to segment your data by: Country: the visitor's country based on their IP address. Subdomain: the subdomain of the page being viewed. You only need to include the subdomain of your target domain, such as www or blog . If you want to create an analytics view that consists only of the root domain (e.g., pages on root.com and not pages on www.root.com ), select Exclude all subdomains . Brand domain (Marketing Hub or Content Hub Enterprise ) : your brand domains. Learn more about brand domains in HubSpot . Please note: the domain must be connected to HubSpot and also requires the Domains Limit Increase . Top-level domain: the end of the domain that comes after the brand domain. (e.g., "com" is the top-level domain for "www.hubspot.com"). URL path starts: the starting characters of the URL path of the page being viewed. URL path contains: text contained in the URL path of the page being viewed. Click Apply filter . Click and to add any additional properties, then click Save . To edit an existing view, hover over the view and click Edit . To delete a view, hover over the view and click Delete . Learn how to apply these analytics views to your data in the traffic analytics tool . Reports

titulo: Optimize your page load time
conteudo: Pages that load quickly provide a better user experience and rank higher in search results . HubSpot's drag and drop editor and template layout editor are designed around best practices in page load time. If your page is loading slowly, it may be due to one of these common causes: Images: images with large file sizes should be resized before you upload them to HubSpot. You can also apply lazy loading to images on your page; this ensures that images only load when a visitor scrolls to them. Rich content: avoid adding large amounts of rich content (e.g., images, gifs, embedded videos) to your page. Autoplaying videos will also increase your page loading time. Broken links: broken links can increase your page loading time and negatively impact your user experience. Learn more about identifying broken links on your HubSpot pages . Broken code: HTML, CSS, or Javascript that is broken or not optimized for speed can drastically slow down your page's speed. These are only a few of the factors that influence page load time. Learn more about how to improve your page speed in our developer documentation . Landing Pages Blog Website Pages
